definitions.definition: a circular decoration for the head, usually made of gold and jewels (= precious stones), and worn by a king or queen at official ceremonies
the act of winning a sports competition:
examples: He plans to defend his Olympic crown.

definitions.definition: to put a crown on someone's head in an official ceremony that makes that person king or queen:
examples: Queen Elizabeth II was crowned (queen) (= made queen in a special ceremony) in 1953.

definitions.definition: If an event or achievement crowns something, it is the best or most successful part of it:
examples: an acting career crowned by her final Oscar-winning performance

definitions.definition: the royal governing power of a country that has a king or queen
